basics.name: Tomáš Dostál
basics.label: Software developer
basics.summary: Proficient and creative computer science student from the Czech Republic, yearning to do something great and meet amazing people. Currently studying at [FIT CTU, Prague](https://fit.cvut.cz/cs) in pursuit of getting a bachelor's degree in Informatics. I believe that computers should make our lives easier and I'm doing my best for this idea to come true. Automatization of processes to help people leave all that boring uncreative work to the computers is something I enjoy a lot. Skilled in creating interesting and interactive websites. Dedicated to superior customer service at all levels from the first meeting with a client to the website maintenance after launch. Detail-oriented and knowledgeable in various programming languages. The most comfortable for me is Python in the Unix ecosystem. Mainly focused on web-related solutions, finding the backend the most enjoyable. Recently started playing around with Raspberry PIs, K8S, docker, and network-related applications in general. Some of my free time goes to smart home and automatization which feels so good! Occasionally playing with my homemade clone of Prusa i3 MK2 3D printer or Arduinos. Fascinated in travelling, and photography. Chose IT in the hope not to be tightened by a fixed 9-5 schedule in an office so I can explore the beauties this wonderful planet offers, thus I'm seeking the freedom to work from wherever I want, whenever I want.

work.name: Paysure Technology s.r.o / Paysure Solutions Ltd
work.summary: Paysure is a fin-tech startup developing a b2b payment solution with an innovative way how to limit card payments by comprehensive criteria. I found the greatest value of the company in the people and company values, like freedom and no blame. I worked here on implementing new features and resolving bugs.
highlights: Strengthened my experiences with Python on BE in agile development
Learned how to use cooperate tools like ClickUp, confluence, bitbucket and slack
Extended my knowledge about Docker, as I used it on the daily bases
Learned basics of AWS infrastructure
Enjoyed working with these cool people
Gained an option to travel while working, as the position was full-remote (although the voluntary option to meet colleagues in a shared office was always available)
Lost the fear of asking for help whenever needed, to move forward

work.name: Self employed
work.summary: Custom website development. From an analysis of customer needs through development itself to deploying and maintaining sites. I am working with clients to solve problems or find solutions to requests, doing my best to stay within budget while still being able to provide clients with exactly what they want. Mostly working with clients having meaningful ideas. The reason for that is I want to leave behind something pleasant to the end-user, but also beneficial. Even though it is simple, since it is a 'clicking monkey' type of job, I'm trying to limit this as I don't see much space fur further grow here.
highlights: Broad experience in building WordPress CMS sites
Customize themes to meet clients’ requirements
Providing technical support to clients
Design new features for existing websites
SEO and analytics
Hosting services

work.name: DCC Ctyrlistek Opava
work.summary: My work here was to help the company switching to a new accounting system, so I developed an automatic conversion tool for them.

work.name: Project DZO
work.position: Identification and improvement of QR code detection
work.summary: [Project DZO](https://www.pdzo.cz/) was a university project aiming to examine the proposed methodology for decontamination of a large number of injured in pre-hospital care and to identify possible shortcomings. My job was to examine possibilities of identification of rescuers with 1-D or 2-D codes for further processing of the captured records.

work.name: Project MedicalApp
work.summary: Since I started exploring the field of IT, I made a lot of my projects. Probably the most significant/interesting one was the medical data viewer „MedicalApp“, which aim was to simplify the process of getting and displaying data from medical facilities.
highlights: 4th place in category IT in the national round of Secondary Scholar Activity
Combining a wide range of languages (C#, Python, C++) and modern technologies (Unity3D, VTK, Google Drive, GTK3)

volunteer.summary: Co-founder of a COVID-19 regulations monitoring site [potrebujurousku.cz](https://www.potrebujurousku.cz/) ([github](https://github.com/tomas-dostal/potrebujurousku)) (ancestor of the official solution [covid.gov.cz](https://covid.gov.cz)) in the Czech Republic.
highlights: Articles about the project in weekly papers '[Respekt](https://www.respekt.cz/agenda/nekdo-to-delat-musi-rika-spoluzakladatelka-webu-potrebuju-rousku-cz)' and '[DenikN](https://denikn.cz/495661/studenti-spustili-web-s-opatrenimi-proti-viru-driv-nez-vlada-pro-lidi-bylo-ubijejici-to-sledovat-vysvetluji)'
Replaced by an official government solution in about three months since published, so the idea of a COVID-19 regulations site was not that bad
Written in Django framework, Python
Scrapping content from the Ministry of Health using BS4 with an attempt to automatically process as much data as possible

volunteer.summary: Redesign of the website [domovenka.cz](domovenka.cz) and general support in the field of web analytics
highlights: Since I started supporting [domovenka.cz](domovenka.cz), the site raised more than 1.7 million CZK from donations
Enjoyed the cooperation with this non-profit, as their main aim is to help people achieve their goals

certificates.name: Database Design and Programming with SQL

skills.name: Tools/languages helping my day to be easier
